Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery lekythos; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of nude male figure, possibly a komast, (midsection of body and chlamys), to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 519, no. C102)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0811) (Phase 1)
